newsitem.title: BRAZIL: CSN could attract Peugeot to Rio de Janeiro - paper.
newsitem.headline: CSN could attract Peugeot to Rio de Janeiro - paper.

text.p: French automaker Peugeot may decide to locate a $600 million factory in Rio de Janeiro state in order to be close to Brazilian steelmaker CSN one of its main parts suppliers, a newspaper said.
CSN planned to be the main supplier of steel products to Peugeot's car factory, expected to produce 70,000 vehicles in its first year of operation, Gazeta Mercantil said.
Gazeta Mercantil said if Peugeot built its planned factory in Resende only 30 km (18.75 miles) away from CSN's steelmill in Volta Redonda the automaker would cut costs and boost efficiency.
CSN aims to increase sales to the car industry to 40 percent of total sales over the next two years from the current 30 percent, Gazeta said.
In 1996, Peugeot sold 9,000 cars in Brazil and expects sales to jump to 12,500 vehicles this year and 20,000 in 1998, the paper said.

Brazil's National Development Bank (BNDES) will be financing up to 60 percent of the $1 billion Peugeot project, which includes the $600 million car plant and installations by suppliers worth $400 million, Gazeta said.
It said the official announcement of the investment is to be made in the first half of this month. ((--Simona de Logu, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 507 4151))
